So, we have:
\[
\lfloor \log_2 N \rfloor = 
\begin{cases}
0 & \text{for }1\leq N \leq1,\\
1 & \text{for }2\leq N \leq3,\\
2 & \text{for }4\leq N \leq7,\\
3 & \text{for }8\leq N \leq15,\\
4 & \text{for }16\leq N \leq31,\\
& \vdots\\
9 & \text{for }512\leq N \leq1023,\\
10 & \text{for }1024\leq N \leq 1024.
\end{cases}
\]

For the given range $1 \le N \le 1024$, there is one $N$ for each of the values $\lfloor \log_2 N \rfloor = 0, 1, \dots, 9$. 

For $\lfloor \log_2 N \rfloor = 10$, there is only one $N$.

So, we can rewrite the sum as:
\begin{align*}
\sum_{N = 1}^{1024} \lfloor \log_2 N \rfloor & = 1\cdot 0 + 2\cdot 1 + 4\cdot 2 + 8\cdot 3 + 16\cdot4 + 32\cdot 5 + 64\cdot6 + 128\cdot 7 + 256\cdot 8 + 512\cdot9+1024\cdot10\\
&= 0+2+ 8+24+64+160+384+896+2048+ 9216\\
&= 14121.
\end{align*}

Therefore, the answer is:
$\boxed{14121}$
